OneSearch is Here!

Sullivan Libraries has added EBSCO Discovery Service (EDS), a one-stop gateway to our books, articles, journals, media, and more—all from a single, powerful search box.

Using OneSearch

üì∫Watch EBSCO's video on using discovery search

  1. Visit the library homepage.
  2. Enter your search terms in the search box. 
  3. Once you search, click the filters button and refine your results.
  4. Click item titles to view full text, generate citations, or save for later.

What Is OneSearch?

A comprehensive tool for searching most of the library’s collections at once. From one search bar, you can find peer-reviewed journal articles, eBooks, streaming videos, print materials and more. On results pages you can use filters and search limiters to refine your results, or access tools like the citation generator, link sharing, and various methods for saving sources.

What's Excluded from OneSearch?

OneSearch includes almost all our subscription resources, with a few exceptions that must be searched separately from the Databases A-Z Page:

  • Eat Your Books
  • Facts and Comparisons
  • PharmacyLibrary's APhA OTC
  • Westlaw
  • Textbooks (VitalSource textbooks are managed by the Sullivan Bookstore)
  • Some public/open access sites listed on our Databases A-Z page, such as USP-NF

Why Should You Use OneSearch?

Features

  • üîç Simplified Searching: Instead of searching multiple databases separately, OneSearch complies results from almost all our subscriptions at once.
  • üìö Comprehensive Results: Access millions of scholarly articles, books, and multimedia resources.
  • üß† Smart Filters: Narrow your results by date, subject, source type, and more.
  • üìÑ Full-Text Access: Quickly find full-text articles and eBooks.
  • üìå Personalized Features: Create an optional, free MyEBSCO Account to save searches, create alerts, and organize your research.

Utility

  • Students: More quickly find credible sources for assignments, papers, and projects.
  • Faculty: Conduct research, locate teaching materials, and stay current in your field.
  • Researchers: Access a wide range of academic content from multiple disciplines.

Need Help?

Sullivan librarians are here to support you! Use Ask a Librarian to contact us or schedule a one-on-one consultation.
